DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate millet incorporation different bake product type influence glycemic response satiety .
DOC.brief_title: Millet Products Study - Investigation Glycemic Index Satiety
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study investigate millet incorporation different bake product type ( i.e . extrude snack versus biscuit ) influence glycemic response satiety . This project examine effect millet , glycemic response satiety . To determine effect product matrix processing method , test do use extruded snack , porridge , couscous-like product biscuit . All product serving provide 50 g available carbohydrate consume participant within 10 minute .
DOC.criteria: Men , age 1940 , nonsmoking Normal fast plasma glucose ( < 5.6 mmol/L 3.6 mmol/L ) Normal glucose tolerance ( evaluated 75 g oral glucose test , i.e . < 7.8 mmol/L 3.6 mmol/L ) BMI range 18.5 29.9 kg/m2 Insulin resistance ( IR ) calculate fast glucose insulin value use Homeostasis Assessment Model 2 ( HOMA2 ) . A HOMA2IR value great 1.0 consider indicative insulin resistance ( Levy J.C. et al . 1998 ) . Regular consumption millet define questionnaire screening define 1x per week Smoking use recreational drug Heavy alcohol use ( define typically > 14 drink per week > 4 drink one occasion ) Very low fibre consumption assess 24 hour food diary selfreported fruit/vegetable/whole grain serving . Restrained eater define questionnaire screening ( Three Factor Eating Questionnaire , Stunkard et al.,1985 ) Food neophobic define Food Neophobia Scale questionnaire Unusual sleep pattern irregular breakfast consumption Recent ( i.e . > 4 kg previous 3 month ) intend weight loss gain Food allergy lifethreatening allergy ( food otherwise ) Inflammatory bowel disease gastrointestinal disorder Use drug influence carbohydrate metabolism Training elite athlete Inability adhere Study Protocols
